main event: A bright light was observed moving slowly across the sky in Killeen, Texas on September 17, 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a light brighter than the brightest stars, with a sharply defined outline.
The object made no distinct sound as it moved slowly across the sky.
The object changed direction, stopping mid-air and moving 25 degrees to the right and dropping 20 degrees.
A small white object was observed circling the main object very quickly.
The sighting lasted for approximately 20 minutes.
